string-array.name: descriptions
string-array.item: It contains an assortment of highly artifacted images of dogs in various settings.
It contains an image of a futuristic looking skyline, blanketed by a binary sunset.
It contains a starchart. The attached date is corrupted.
It contains a 30 page review of an old T-shirt with a stylized print consisting of a lunar body behind three howling dogs.
It contains a video file showcasing two Urbworld gangs fighting for territory.
It contains nothing. It is completely blank.
It contains a slightly corrupted video file showcasing a Rimworld explorer watching a ship explode in the upper atmosphere.
It contains a text file entitled 'Cryptosleep Revival Briefing'.
It contains an image of an artist's impression of the anatomy of a Thrumbo.
It contains a video file showcasing an advertisement for Glitterworld foot massages.
It contains an old entertainment application depicting the management of a planetary colony.
It contains an outdated ethics paper on the use of mechanical units in Urbworld crowd control.
The decoding process has unfortunately damaged this datadisk beyond recovery.
It contains videos of cats reacting badly to certain foods.
It contains a series of image files that are too corrupted and unable to be viewed.
It contains a series of text files. The contents appear to be scout reports on mechanoid movements.
It contains a single audio file. Of what can be discerned, it appears to be a poor soul being accosted by mechanoids.
It contains various handcrafted images of animals in their natural habitats.
It contains an image of two people standing victorious, with a Thrumbo corpse in the background.
This datadisk contains an image of various animals inside cages.
This datadisk contains an image of rolling hills. In the distance, a mechanoid hive can be seen.
This datadisk contains a large amount of images of cats. The images have humourous text added to them.
This datadisk contains a slightly corrupted video file. The video shows mechanoids being lured into an ambush.
This datadisk contains someone's personal diary. The files are mostly corrupted. From what can be deciphered, the author of the diary was an unfortunate victim of a bandit attack.
This datadisk contains an assortment of extremely old entertainment applications.
This datadisk contains various images of what appears to be a marriage ceremony.
This datadisk contains an assortment of low quality images appearing to show UFOs.

This datadisk contains a video file. The video is security camera footage of a civilian ship. Towards the end of the video, the hull appears to rupture, apparently from an explosion from outside of the ship.
This datadisk contains a single video file. The video shows a meteorite striking a planet.
This datadisk contains various text files. They appear to be guides on how to correctly skin animals of various species.

This datadisk contains a single, heavily corrupted video file. The video appears to show a group of rimworld explorers attempting to open a ruined structure. The video abruptly ends when the group creates an opening.
